questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You have a model-driven app. You create five Microsoft Excel templates for analyzing customer data.
Four of the templates must be available to all users. The remaining template must be available only to you. You configure the appropriate security roles for users.
You need to determine how to upload the Excel templates.
Which method should you use? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//
questions.answer_description:
Box 1: In the Settings menu, select Document Templates
Templates uploaded from the Settings page are available to all users. You don't need to take any further action.
Administrators can use the Settings page to upload the Excel template. A template uploaded in Settings is available to all users.
For admins: Upload the Excel template
1. Go to Settings > Templates > Document Templates.
2. Click Upload Template.
3. Drag the Excel file into the dialog box or browse to find and upload the file.
4. Upload Template dialog box.
5. Click Upload.
Box 2: In the view for the email records, select Excel templates
Note: For non-admins or admins wanting to create a personal template: Upload the Excel template
Open a page with a list of records, for example, the list of Sales Opportunities. Go to Sales > Opportunities > My Open Opportunities.
1. On the menu bar, click Excel Templates > Create Excel Template.
2. Click Excel Template > Upload.
3. Click Upload to add the Excel template.
4. Drag the file into the dialog box or browse to find and upload the file.
5. Click Upload.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/admin/analyze-your-data-with-excel-templates

questions.question_text:

You configure an alert in Power BI.
You need to alert users when the value of a tile exceeds a threshold. To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Correct.
You can set alerts on tiles in your My Workspace (POWERbi).
Only you can see the alerts you set, even if you share your dashboard. Even the dashboard owner can't see alerts you set on your view of their dashboard

questions.question_text:
You are using Power BI to build a dashboard for a company.
You must make the dashboard available to a specific set of users, including employees and five external users. The number of employees that require access to the dashboard varies, but is usually less than 100.
Employees and external users must not be permitted to share the dashboard with other users.
You need to share the dashboard with the employees and external users.
Which three actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

F is the correct answer

distribution group is one of the options.

To share the Power BI dashboard with the specified users while ensuring they cannot share it further, you should perform the following actions:

B. Sign into the Power BI service. Open the dashboard and select Share. This allows you to access the sharing options for the dashboard1.
C. Enter the individual email address of internal and external users. This ensures that only the specified users receive access to the dashboard2.
E. Clear the Allow recipients to share your dashboard (or report) option. This prevents the users from sharing the dashboard with others, maintaining control over who has access

Selected Answer: BCE
BCE of course. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/collaborate-share/service-share-dashboards
- Use a security group, not a distribution group, to share with a group that includes people with external email addresses.
BCE is the correct answer

Only your direct recipients see the shared report or dashboard. For example, if you sent the email to Vicki@contoso.com, only Vicki sees the dashboard. No one else can see the dashboard, even if Vicki forwards them the link. Vicki must use the same email address to access it; if Vicki signs in with any other email address, Vicki won't have access to the dashboard.

Use a security group, not a distribution group, to share with a group that includes people with external email addresses. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/collaborate-share/service-share-dashboards

Correct.
When you share a dashboard with colleagues you are sharing the underlying dataset as well. Your colleagues get access to the entire dataset unless row-level security (RLS) limits their access. Report authors may use capabilities that customize user experiences when viewing or interacting with reports, for example hiding columns, limiting the actions on visuals, and others. These customized user experience do not restrict what data users can access in the dataset. Use row-level security (RLS) in the dataset so that each person's credentials determine which data they can access.

comments.content: correct, thank you

discussion.content: Row is the new terminology being used for field. So this is field level security, which would be the right answer.

comments.content: don't confuse peoples...

Not correct. row = record, and the new name for Field is Column. 
So RLS is not related to field security at all.
wrong, field is a record, rows and columns haven't changed terminology

Rows in a traditional database are equivalent to Records in Dataverse.
Columns in a traditional database are equivalent to Fields in Dataverse.

discussion.content:
To ensure that each group of employees can see only the data that pertains to their group, you should:

C. Create and assign roles by using row-level security (RLS).

Row-level security allows you to restrict data access for users based on filters you define within roles. You can create roles and apply filters that ensure each group of employees only sees the data relevant to them1

discussion.content:
Copilot
To integrate prebuilt AI Builder models with Power Automate flows for the scenarios you described, you should use the following models:

Extract key phrases from a PDF document:

Key Phrase Extraction: This prebuilt model identifies important phrases in text, making it suitable for extracting key phrases from PDF documents.
Determine the likelihood that customers will purchase additional products:

Prediction Model: This model can be used to predict outcomes based on historical data. For determining the likelihood of customers purchasing additional products, you can use a prebuilt prediction model.
These models can be easily integrated into Power Automate flows to automate and enhance your business processes.

Extract key phrases from a PDF document:
C. Text recognition model and key phrases extraction model. First, use the Text recognition model to extract text from the PDF document, and then apply the Key phrase extraction model to identify key phrases from the extracted text1.

Determine the likelihood that customers will purchase additional products:
D. Prediction model. The Prediction model in AI Builder is designed to analyze patterns in historical data and predict future outcomes, such as the likelihood of customers purchasing additional products

How on earth can a sentiment analysis model predict the likelihood of a customer to buy additional products? I mean, e.g. to select all customers where the likelihood is over 93.2% ? 
The only reason is a potential hypothesis that happy customers may buy again. But it is not what the sentiment analysis does (eg in a Monopoly an very unhappy customer is highly likely for re purchase. In tourist places with high walk-in customers the extremely happy customer is unlikely to buy again as he might have gone home). But i also see the point that prediction models are not prebuilt. Thanks to all the comments, i know now what the expected answer should be.
answer is correct.

2: Sentiment analysis

it says that"For PDF documents, only the first 2,000 pages are processed." which makes the answer correct I think.

Question 1 is Text Rec AND Key Phrase Extraction. The question clearly says "EXTRACT KEY PHRASES". Because it's a PDF, you must first use Text Recognition, and then ALSO use Key Phrase Extraction. Text Recognition alone WILL NOT extract key phrases, instead, it's just a data prep step to enable the Key Phrase Extraction model to do its job.

Second should be Sentiment Analysis. Prediction would be better, but is not a pre-built model, so doesn't satisfy the constraints given in the question.

I think the first one should be Key phrase extraction model as it is designed to extract key phrases as specified. The text recognition model only reads hand-written notes or printed content when you take a pic of it. 

For the second one, it should be Sentiment Analysis.
For me is: 1. Just Key Phrase Extraction model and 2. Sentiment analysis model. PS. For Q1 >> The question specifically asks only for key phrases, not some other text.

I think right answers are :
-Text recognition model
-Sentiment analysis model

Prediction are not prebuilt models but custom...

discussion.content:
In exam on 21 July 2021
In exam. But not exact. Prepare all AI modules. Reading PDF is only the capability of 'Text Recognition' model.

The answer is correct! 
1. The key word is "specific text". For example, the PDF file contains a line "This is Chanel 8 for young lady, not old lady". Text Recognition will extract the whole text from the file but it can't identify the key phrase "Chanel 8". That's why we also need key phrase, my friends.
2. Prediction Model isn't prebuilt even though it's way better than sentiment analytics.

The given anwsers are correct. You should first process the pdf with text recognition and then analyze the output with key phrase, to get the “SPECIFIC TEXT”. So the first one is text recognition and key phrase extraction. The second one is sentiment analysis since the build type for the prediction model is custom and the question asked for a PREBUILT model.
The first one is correct because it says "The company plans to use the AI Builder model to make key business decisions" so **in addition** of using Text recognition you shoud identify key frases.
Why the second one couldn't be Category classification? The description of it looks pretty useful for business decisions.
in exam 10 June 2021

it's hard to believe that the answer is 'sentíment analysis model' because the requirement is determine de likelihood... (in typical escenario when the customers purchase products) is perfect to prediction model but the prediction model isn't a prebuilt model. For discard only remains sentiment analysis ...

comments.content:
But I hardly can imagine that sentiment analysis model (what is it going to analyze? the last email?) can predict the required outcome.
We need more data for it, and it can be done only with Prediction, imho.

discussion.content: Key phrase is not correct. How do you extract "specific" words such as only hello via key phrase? The model decides on his own the key phrases.

The first question asks for 'specific text', so wouldn't the Key Phrase Extraction model be the most appropriate for this scenario? I realize the Text Recognition model extracts handwritten or text from pictures, but these aren't 'specific', which is what the question is asking.

comments.content:
Agree, so far nobody noticed this important fact.

If you have text in the image you need the Text Recognition model. If text is already digitalized, i.e. you can easily copy it and paste to some text editor from PDF, then Text Recognition is not needed. That has not been stated in the question.

I agree with that assessment, conditions in the power automate flow can than be used to filter out specific text. However - assuming the provided answer is correct - I guess the reasoning is that although the 'KPE' method doesn't allow specific text to be extracted, it's more specific than all text. Still, only a PDF image would need text recognition to be performed first, but most PDF files are readable by default (there's no mention of that in the question).

Refer to @Faulerbock's reply.

Key Phrase Extraction does not allow for extraction of specific texts rather it uses it's prebuilt model configurations to auto extract whatever it believes to be the key phrase.
